channel.title: Health
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Health, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why Potassium Matters for Heart Health
Shoveling snow can be dangerous. Here's how to protect yourself
item.description: This weekend's winter storm brought a lot of heavy, wet snow to parts of the country, which makes shoveling a tougher task. Cardiologist Dr. John Osbo...

item.title: Conditions That Can Resemble a Migraine
item.description: Some headaches can look or feel similar to migraine. Learn about other conditions that may present in comparable ways and how they’re often told apart...

item.title: Follow This Zero-Stress Guide To Eat More Protein (& Enjoy Your Meals)
How long do you need to spend in the gym to get strong? Less than you think
item.description: If you're procrastinating working out, here's one less excuse. Short gym sessions can be enough to build meaningful strength — as long as you push you...

item.title: As GLP-1s become more available, some who aren't overweight may consider using them
item.description: As GLP-1 drugs become more available, some people might use them despite not having excess weight.

item.title: The Overlooked Link Between Chronic Dry Eye and Your Overall Well-Being
item.description: Chronic dry eye can disrupt your quality of life—sometimes in ways you may not even be considering. What to know & how to treat it.

item.title: This Common Nighttime Habit May Raise Heart Disease Risk By Up To 35%
item.description: And almost all of us are guilty of this habit

item.title: Dry Eye After LASIK or Vision Correction? What No One Warns You About
item.description: Getting a vision correction can be life changing. But it’s not free of potential side effects. The most common? Dry eye.

item.title: Why Aren’t Your Eye Drops Working? 5 Hidden Triggers Making Dry Eye Worse
item.description: When your eyes feel dry, you probably reach for OTC eye drops. The catch? OTC eye drops can soothe symptoms, but they don’t target the root cause.

item.title: A CrossFit-like race is booming in Asia, and young people are driving the surge
item.description: Hyrox, a timed fitness race that mixes running with workout stations, is selling out across Asia as young people fuel a booming wellness economy.

item.title: Here's how 'shared decision making' for childhood vaccines could limit access
item.description: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s new approach to six shots that were formerly given routinely will introduce new hurdles for getting kids immunized. And it cou...
